alert.note: Alert for Macon; Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 28 at 9:42PM CDT until June 29 at 12:45AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: The National Weather Service in Birmingham has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Montgomery County in south central Alabama... Southwestern Macon County in southeastern Alabama... * Until 1245 AM CDT. * At 942 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated slow-moving thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen, especially east of downtown Montgomery. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Montgomery, Pike Road, Shorter, Auburn University In Montgomery, Eastdale Mall, Mount Meigs, Pinedale, Lagoon Park, Gunter Air Force Base, Alabama State University, Waugh, Alabama State Capitol, Montgomery Riverwalk Stadium, Snowdoun, Hyundai Motors Of Alabama, Tysonville, Maxwell Air Force Base, Hope Hull, Woodcrest and Dannelly Field. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
